bibl.title: Fred S. Walton v. John G. Boyle. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The United States Circuit Court, Northern Division, State of Washington

div1.ab: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT, SOUTHERN Northern DIVISION, STATE OF WASHINGTON, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
In the matter of the application of F. S. Walton for a writ of Habeas Corpus
div1.p: On reading and filing the petition of F.S.Walton, duly signed and verified by him whereby it appears that he is illegally imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by John G. Boyle at the city of North Yakima, in the County of Yakima, State of Washington, and stating wherein the illegality consists from which it appears to me that a writ of habeas corpus ought to issue, it is ordered that a writ of habeas corpus issue out of and under the seal of this court directed to the said John G. Boyle, commanding him to have the body of the said Fred S. Walton before me in the court room of the said court on the 9th day of September at two P.M. o'clock of that day to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said F. S. Walton, together with the time and cause of his detention and that he have then and there the said writ
div1.ab: In the United States District Court, for the District of Washington, Northern Southern Division State of Washington

FILED IN THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT, DIST. OF WASHINGTON.
SEP 7 1901
A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk
R. M. Hopkins Dep,
